result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Montreal Staples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Montreal Staples is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Montreal Staples was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Anthony Montreal Staples was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Order for Commitment signed on 3/11/2016.

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples not in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Defendant not appearing.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 07-15-2015 received and filed. (28 Pages.)  CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  ALVIN UGENT, PUBLIC DEFENDER APPOINTMENT.

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Agent in court; memorandum has been filed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant, agent requesting another review.  Additional review set for 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
At request of probation agent, probation review is adjourned for 60 days to allow defendant to begin treatment programming as just released from custody.
Count five.
Count four.

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #4: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to any other sentences), with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT #5: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR;  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".  The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (count #5):
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Diandra H.   
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- pay the costs and fees for count #4.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
   Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Diandra H., or her residence or members of her family.  mld
Court ordered defendant to have no weapons in possession, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent and Attorney Robert Haney.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and Granted by the Court.  The Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $500.00.   mld

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent and Attorney Robert Haney.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1, #2, #3 and COUNT #6 are dismissed on prosecutor's motion.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #4 (without the repeater) and COUNT #5 with the repeater: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent and Attorney Robert Haney.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #4 to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent and Attorney Robert Haney.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court heard and granted the motion of the State for the Use of the 911 call.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case passed upon the request of parties.   mld

Defendant, Anthony Montreal Staples in court with Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Attorney Ugent will remain as counsel.  Parties are prepared for trial.  Case passed.   mld

Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent in court, defendant Anthony Montreal Staples not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  The State is prepared to proceed on officer observation and 911 cd.   Case passed.   mld
addressed to the court from Diandra H., received and filed.   mld

Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent in court, defendant Anthony Montreal Staples not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All discovery has been turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld
received and filed.   mld

Petition and Order for Funeral Pass.  
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the petition is granted for the defendant to attend the funeral of Sharon Staples who is the defendant's mother.  The funeral is scheduled to take place at 11:00 am on 4-10-2015 at Williamson Funeral Home, 2157 N. 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205.  The defendant shall be released no later than 10:00 am on 4-10-2015, and shall return to the House of Correction within 3 hours.  The defendant shall remain absolutely sober and comply with all the rules of the Correctional Facility that is responsible for the defendant's custody.  The defendant will be escorted by the Milwaukee County Correction Officers or Sheriff's Deputies, observing such security precautions as the custodian determines.  Order, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in court with attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent.  Defendant Anthony Montreal Staples in custody.  
Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Katie Seelow (under the student practice rule).  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer  David Grycowski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty on all counts.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-5-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 6-24-2015 at 8:30 am.     

Upon the request of defense, with no objection by the State, the Court would approve the defendant to make a visit at the funeral of his mother on 4-10-2015, under the security of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Funeral pass arrangments to be made by defense counsel.   mld
